page.title: 07Bradfield Quarry.
page.content: The quarry in our area is called Loadfield Quarry.They are getting sandstone from the quarry.It is bought and used for building,crazy paving, walling and fireplaces. The stone is very near the surface and the quarry face is about 4 metres in depth.They use machinery and hand tools to get the stone.The blocks are loaded into a lorry.Some is taken away, some is "dressed" and smalll pieces are discarded.The "dressing"is done on the site in a large shed.A sort of guillotine is used and hand-tools.An old gentleman works here using a hammer and chisel.He has worked here for 45 years.The dressed stone had beautiful patterns in rust and beige colours.Five people are employed at the quarry.The quarry is surrounded by spoil heaps which have been colonised by heather, grass and bilberry.
